rbiom 1.0.3.9060

Display beta diversities in an all vs all grid.

Source: R/bdiv_heatmap.r
bdiv_heatmap.Rd

Display beta diversities in an all vs all grid.

bdiv_heatmap(
  biom,
  metric = "Bray-Curtis",
  weighted = TRUE,
  color.by = NULL,
  order.by = NULL,
  colors = NULL,
  orders = NULL,
  xlab.angle = "auto",
  tree = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

biom

A BIOM object, as returned from read_biom.

metric

Beta diversity metric(s) to use. Options are "Manhattan", "Euclidean", "Bray-Curtis", "Jaccard", and "UniFrac". UniFrac requires a phylogenetic tree. Default: "Bray-Curtis".

weighted

Should the beta diversity metric be weighted by abundances? Default: TRUE.

color.by

Add annotation tracks for these metadata column(s). Default: NULL.

order.by

Which metadata columns to use for ordering the samples across the x-axis. The default setting, order.by=NULL, uses sample names as labels and arranges samples by similarity. See plot_heatmap for details.

colors

A named list() with names matching color.by, each specifying a palette as described in plot_heatmap. For example: colors = list(Sex = c(Male="blue", Female="red")). Default: NULL.

orders

Subset to just these values in the order.by metadata column. Default: NULL.

xlab.angle

How to rotate the tick labels on the x-axis. 'auto' (the default), automatically selects a rotation value. 0, 30, and 90 sets the angle to horizontal, angled, and vertical, respectively.

tree

A phylogenetic tree for use in calculating UniFrac distance. The default, NULL, will use the BIOM object's tree.

...

Additional arguments to pass on to plot_heatmap.

Value

A ggplot2 plot. The computed data points will be attached as

attr(, 'data').

See also

Other plotting: adiv_boxplot(), bdiv_boxplot(), ordination_plot(), plot_heatmap(), taxa_boxplot(), taxa_heatmap(), taxa_stacked()

Examples

    library(rbiom)
    
    biom <- hmp50 %>% rarefy() %>% select(1:10)
    bdiv_heatmap(biom, color.by="Body Site")
